Josh goes somewhere else
1.content:
Joshua Handy had just finished serving as the altar boy during mass in church that morning. He was wearing a long, white robe with long sleeves and a silver chain with a cross around his neck, which he thought was really cool because it also made him look a little bit like a priest. He almost wished he could wear the robe a little longer but he knew he had to remove it as soon as mass was over.

This is what Joshua looks like:
http://www.writing.com/main/images/item_...

When the people started leaving the sanctuary, Josh walked into the bathroom to change when he saw a bright light before him. Then, another boy materialized before him, wearing a brown robe with a rope tied around his waist. The boy was short, he looked around 10 years old and had black hair and he began to speak to Josh.

"Hi, Josh. I see you like to be the altar boy. That's very good. I'm going to give you my powers for one cosmic day." the boy said.

"What? Who are you?" Josh asked. “What’s a cosmic day?”

"You come to worship me during mass every Sunday. From now on, people will come to mass and they will worship you instead!" the boy responded. “A cosmic day can be anywhere from five minutes to a hundred years!”

"Huh?" Josh replied. “What are you talking about?”

"I am God, but you will be God from now on, while I sleep for one cosmic day." the boy said, as he placed his hands on Josh's shoulders. "You will now have all my knowledge, all my wisdom and all my powers. You're in charge of the universe, Josh. Everything you say will happen. Every one of your commands will be carried out!"

The boy with black hair disappeared, leaving Josh alone in the bathroom.

Josh was 10 years old, he had blond hair and blue eyes and he was 5 feet tall. He was God.

When Josh walked out of the bathroom, he saw Father Williams, who lead the mass just a few minutes before. The Father asked Josh if he could take off his robe and place it in the closet.

"Gosh, I would like to keep my robe a little longer than today..." Josh sighed.

Father Williams suddenly agreed.

"Sure, Josh. Keep the robe as long as you want!"

Josh was astonished. The priest had never allowed that before! Josh then walked around and talked to people, suddenly knowing the names of every single person who was there, even the visitors!
1.title: Meet Joshua

choices: He changes some things in and around the church
He sees a boy his age at church who he's never met before
He tries to avenge Mrs. Reynolds' car
He takes a walk down the street to the park
He tries to see if he can change himself
11.content:
As Josh waved goodbye to the priest and the group of people talking to him, he thought to himself, "How do I know everyone's names like that? I've never met any of these people before!! If that boy that appeared to me really is God..." Walking down the path from the church to the sidewalk, he looked for something to test out, to see if he really did have those powers. 

Out in the parking lot, he recognized Mrs. Reynolds slowly walking out to her car. Josh liked Mrs. Reynolds a lot; she was a sweet old lady who lived four doors down from his family, and would come over once a week to chat with Josh's mom, usually bringing cookies or some other baked goods. His mother had once explained to him, "Mr. Reynolds passed away about the time you were born, and Mrs. Reynolds didn't have any other family, so she decided to adopt the entire block as her family." Every day she would visit four or five houses to check in and catch up on what was going on, and she seemed to show real interest in everyone's lives, never gossiping or talking about people behind their backs, but always remembering even the smallest detail of what someone had told her. Even with all that, she still found a way come to church three times a week, always attentive and reverent. As far as Josh was concerned, she was a saint.

"Hello, Josh," Mrs. Reynolds called out as he started walking beside her. "Excellent service today, as always. You looked especially smart and handsome in your robe."

Josh blushed a little, happy for the compliment. "Thanks, Mrs. Reynolds," he said. "It was great to see ya at church today. I'm glad you enjoyed it."

Her eyes glowed as her wrinkly cheeks it up in a smile. "Oh, I've gotten enough enjoyment out of life as it is. I just love seeing the Creator express himself through young people like you. He has a plan and a purpose for you, even if you don't know what that is yet."

"Wow," Josh thought, "she is more right with that than she knows."

As she said goodbye and walked over to her car, Josh's smile began to fade. The old car looked like it had seen better days. The right fender was mangled and falling off, and the headlight above it had been smashed in. "Gee," Josh thought, "she deserves better than that." His eyes lit up as he realized something. "And I can give it to her!"

When she opened the door, Josh quickly kneeled down and placed his hand on the twisted piece of metal. As he did so, he suddenly saw the world change around him in a flash. The sky darkened and the church had disappeared. He quickly realized he was experiencing a vision, as he couldn't turn his head in either direction. Mrs. Reynolds's car was now parked in the driveway in front of her house. Josh watched in horror as two teenagers walked up to the car holding a baseball bat. Snickering, they swung the bat back and hit the headlight, sending shards of glass flying. Again and again they banged it, until the fender was bent completely out of shape.

Josh snapped back to reality, a new sense of determination on his face. He focused on the fender, and as he did so, he felt a slight tingling sensation flow through it. As he watched, wide-eyed, the fender straightened back out and became whole again, affixing itself back to the rest of the car. The glass in the headlight reappeared, after a few seconds looking as good as new. 

Josh smiled. "That's much better." As Mrs. Reynolds started the engine, he quickly stood up and stepped back. He saw the headlights come on, and after a few seconds, the window rolled down and Mrs. Reynolds stuck her head out.

"Is that right headlight working now?" When Josh nodded, Mrs. Reynolds laughed. "It's been out for nearly a year, and now it suddenly starts working again! God does provide, if you're patient enough."

Josh smiled and waved as she drove off. "He sure does," he said aloud, as he thought about what to do next.
11.title: Mrs. Reynolds

choices: Josh grows Caleb two feet taller with a muscular build so he can defend himself
Josh makes Caleb an 18-year-old with his own place so he can live on his own
Josh changes history so Caleb's dad is still alive, and his life is much better
112.content:
As Josh breathed deeply, taking in the warm spring air, he noticed a boy around his own age sitting on one of the benches in a small grassy area between the church entrance and the parking lot. The boy was a scrawny, short kid, several inches shorter than than Josh, with red hair, pale skin, and lots and lots of freckles. He didn't remember ever having seen this boy before, at church or anywhere else, but the name Caleb suddenly appeared in his mind. "There's that omniscience at work again," he smiled to himself.

He walked closer to the boy, but was overcome with a sudden feeling of despair, sadness, and inner turmoil. He glanced over at Caleb, who was looking down at the ground as he swung his feet back and forth below the bench. "Something is troubling this boy a great deal," Josh realized. He decided to go investigate.

Walking to the bench, he stood in front of Caleb. "Hi," he said softly.

The red-haired boy avoided eye contact with Josh, still looking down at his feet. "Hey," he mumbled.

Josh sat down on the bench next to him. "I've never seen you at church before. Are you new?"

The boy turned slightly away from Josh, apparently unwilling to talk to a stranger. Josh breathed in slightly, closing his eyes. He could tell the boy was in pain, but how could he find out more about him and help if he didn't speak? Then he remembered the vision of Mrs. Reynolds's car being vandalized. "I wonder..."

He looked for a way to touch the boy without being too obvious. Stretching and reaching out his hand casually along the top of the bench, Josh brushed it against the side of Caleb's shoulder. Instantly, he saw a flash, and then stood inside a plainly decorated bedroom in what looked to be a small, neglected house. Caleb was lying face-down on the bed, crying softly into his pillow.

Suddenly, the door flung open, a dirty, unshaven man coming into the room. Josh could detect a strong smell of alcohol coming from the man, and he staggered up to the bed, obviously very drunk.

"W-whatddya doin' cryin' there like a--a BABY!" The unpleasant man sneered at Caleb. "Just like yer stupid mother. Dontcha two apreshate whatcha I do fer you? I's work my hands to the millbone fer ya slobs, and this is the thanks I getch?"

Caleb jumped off of the bed, his face red and streaked with tears, an incredible, passionate anger building. "Don't you dare talk about my mom that way, you drunk!" He clenched his hand into a fist, pulling it back and swinging it at the man's stomach. It hit with a soft thud, knocking him back but only momentarily.

The drunk man's sneer became a mean-spirited grin. He lunged for Caleb, grabbing his shirt collar with one hand and slapping the boy in the face with the other. "Howdja like that, you li'l ingrate!" He hit Caleb again, throwing him back down on the bed. "That's whadja git for talkin' back to me!"

Caleb glared up at the man looming above him, still fiercely defiant despite the beating he had just received. "I wish my mom had never met you! I wish... I wish..." His voice trailed off as he started tearing up again.

Josh noticed that Caleb was looking down at a framed photograph on his bedside table of a handsome, well-built man dressed in a Marine Corps uniform. Sitting in front of the photo was a small medal on a ribbon. that Josh quickly identified as a Purple Heart.

A chortle escaped from the man's lips as he saw what the boy was looking at. "Your daddy? He's sleepin' ina shallow grave in Afg-- Afgani-(hic)-stan. Wishin's not gonna bring 'em back! Stupid kid." He continued to laugh as he walked out of the room down the hall.

Josh blinked, and he was back in front of the church. He looked over at Caleb, nearly in tears after seeing the boy's incredibly sad past. "What can I even possibly do for you, Caleb..." he whispered.

He didn't really intend for the boy to hear him, but Caleb turned around, a shocked look on his face. "H-how do you know my name?"

Josh took a deep breath and tried to smile. "It's a long story, I guess. I can tell you if you want. Let's just say I want to help you."

"Help me? With what?"

Josh looked straight into his eyes, seeing and feeling the hurt in Caleb's soul but also knowing there was a strong-minded and intelligent young man yearning to break free. He made up his mind. "I'm gonna you become happy again, Caleb."

"W-what do you mean?" Caleb looked at Josh uneasily, definitely apprehensive but with a flicker of faith and hope in his eyes. Josh remembered the passage that Father Williams read that very morning where Jesus said faith the size of a mustard seed could move mountains. "Well, I don't think I need to go that far," Josh thought, "but I think I know what I need to do..."
112.title: Boy in Pain

choices: Asked Josh if they could be friends and hang out.
Asked Josh if he could make him grow more, increasing his height and muscularity
Asked Josh if he could become Josh's big brother... permanently
1121.content:
Josh did not want to alter the time-space continuum by changing the course of history. A smart young boy keen to detail, Josh remembered this fact when his older brother Tom was talking about it at home one day. So, Josh knew what he had to do. Instead of bringing Caleb's father back to life, just as the other God did with Jesus, Josh decided to alter Caleb's genetic structure.

"I have made a decision. I know how I am going to help you," explained Josh, standing up. "Can you please stand up, Caleb?"

"S...sure." Caleb got up slowly. Then, Josh closed his eyes and stuck his hand out towards Caleb, but not yet touching him. All of a sudden, Caleb was levitating, floating two feet above the ground. He noticed that Josh was concentrating all of his brain power on him.

Then, Caleb noticed a wonderful sensation pulsating through his bones, muscles, and veins. A bright, blue light began to shine around him, glowing like the moon. The sensation became much more noticeable as it spread throughout his entire body. At first, he thought it was nothing. But then, something amazing started to happen...

Caleb felt incredibly strange and happy simultaneously. He glanced down. His legs began to vibrate. His bones erupted with a sharp but soothing pain as they got longer. They got so long that they reached the ground below, making him a whopping 6'4" tall, which is very tall for a ten year-old. With the newly added growth, his abdomen got longer making him appear very skinny, which was all about to change soon. Then, his feet cramped. They grew out if his shoes, shooting out quickly, tearing his one pair of dress shoes. They quickly surpassed the single digits range and stopped growing at size 14 feet.

A few seconds later, the tingling sensation moved upwards towards his legs. His legs began to expand with newly formed muscle. His calf muscles quadrupled in size, making them as big as softballs. His quads also quadrupled in size, resembling thick sheets of metal. His shorts, due to his increased height, went a quarter of his way to his knees, but luckily, his boxers grew with him. His legs resembled those of professional cyclists.

The sensation kept moving up. His torso became larger to support the body that was about to come. The gut of his belly seemed to melt away. Replacing his flab was an 8-pack of abs, hard as steel. They were so chiseled and effect that they looked as if they were cut by Michaelangelo on a block of marble for a statue. Then, his chest began to widen, forming a little chasm between his nipples. His pectorals began to inflate like large water balloons, but they weren't squishy. They were as hard as rock. They became so large that they obstructed his view of Josh who was supposedly standing in front of him.

Caleb became incredibly excited, but the deed was not done just yet. His back and arms had yet to be developed. His shoulders widened so that they were the same distance away as his legs so as to balance his body. His back became incredibly toned and muscular, similar to those of professional bodybuilders.

The next part of his body to be changed were his biceps. Before being changed, they were very short and thin. But, when the blue glow and the tingling sensation reached his arms, they began to expand. His biceps became so big that they resembled giant boulders, capable of crushing someone's head if it came between them. Caleb's hands then doubled in size, becoming larger than a basketball.

Finally, Josh slightly changed the appearance of Caleb's face. Josh erased some of Caleb's freckles with the waving of his hand as well as got rid of all the acne. He then gave Caleb a chiseled chin and left everything else alone.

After the transformation, the blue glow vanished. Caleb was given full control over his bodily movements. He was now able to jump high into the air, lift trucks with ease, and run with incredible speed and agility.

Caleb took a few steps back and looked down at Josh. Josh looked up to his new muscular friend and smiled.

"Thanks! This is so freaking cool!" Called bellowed. His voice had gotten considerable deeper due to the added testosterone in his system. He bent down on one knee and shook hands with Josh. Caleb's hand was so much bigger than Josh's head.

"It's not a problem, my gargantuan friend. I hope you put these muscle to good use. I know that you re pure of heart and will do just that," replied Josh with a calm voice.

Caleb then...

choices: Josh grows Caleb even a little taller and more muscular
Josh and Caleb go to the shopping mall and run into some friends
11213.content:
Josh looked up at the towering boy, who seemed more than happy with his new height and muscles.

"There! Now, go and enjoy your life, Caleb!" Josh smiled, as he was about to turn around and walk off.

Caleb looked on for a moment before he ran after Josh and caught up to him using his long, muscular legs.

"Wait.... Josh, WAIT!"

Josh stopped and calmly turned around.

The hulking boy then wrapped his giant, muscular arms around Josh, completely enveloping the smaller boy.

"Thank you so much, Josh..." Caleb said, as tears rolled from his eyes.

Then Caleb pulled back, and stared at Josh.

"Are you... God?"

"Yeah..." Josh replied quietly.

"Josh... Do you have a younger brother?"

"No..." Josh replied.

"I know I'm bigger than you, but... Can I... Can I be your brother?" Caleb sobbed. "I love mom, but... I can't bear to go home anymore... I can't live with my stepfather anymore..."

"Umm... Come with me to my house first..." Josh said.

Josh snapped his fingers and him and Caleb appeared standing before Josh's house.

Then Josh opened then door and allowed Caleb inside.

Josh's mother was home from working at the clothing store.

"Mom... This is Caleb! Can he stay over at our house for awhile?" he asked his mother.

"Sure, Josh... No problem..." his mother, Julie, replied.

Josh and Caleb walked into Josh's bedroom where Josh immediately changed then closet into a second, even larger bedroom with a bed, a desk, closet space and another bathroom! There was a dresser filled with clothes which fit Caleb as well.

Then Josh looked up at Caleb.

"You want to be my big bro?"

"Sure!" Caleb smiled.

"Okay... From now on... You're my brother... FOR REAL!" Josh ordered.

Caleb changed again. His face began to resemble a little bit like that of Josh. The only difference was that Caleb was just over a foot taller than Josh. But his face, eyes and hair resembled Josh's face, hair and eyes now. They looked like brothers!

"There! Your name is now Caleb Handy!" Josh grinned. "You're my big bro... Even though I'm also 10 years-old! But you're much bigger than me!"

"Thank you, little bro!" Caleb cheered, as he hugged his little brother.

"Hey you guys! Come and eat!" Julie said.

"Thanks, mom!" Josh said.

"I'm coming, mom!" Caleb added.

"I'm so happy to have a BIG BRO like you!" Josh smiled, looking up at his hulking brother.

Josh just wondered what to do next...

Caleb askes his dad if he could hang out with Josh some more...
Caleb askes if Josh could come over...
1123.content:
Josh turned over the things he could do in his head...

Making him two feet taller and buff would require some tweaking of both space and time. It would solve the problem, but Josh wondered if Caleb's life would be any better that way. The media attention a 6 foot 6 inch tall 10 year old would get would probably hurt Caleb more than help him. Josh, seeing Caleb's soul, could tell the boy didn't like a tremendous amount of attention. Also, Caleb might not take to his newfound enormous body well. The power could possibly destroy him.

Making him 18 would require a lot of fiddling with the timeline. Josh could fiddle with the timeline as much as he wanted to. But would it solve the problem and not make even bigger problems? He'd loose his dad later on in life and it would affect him differently. If he lost his dad at 13 as opposed to 5, Caleb might turn to drugs. He'd have a place of his own, but he'd be a drugie. Josh knew that wouldn't help at all. It was trading one evil for another, and the other would be Caleb's doing.

That left a third option: Bringing Caleb's dad back from the dead... or actually making it so he wouldn't die in the first place. That'd be easiest; not that it mattered. But now that Josh thought about it, it was the best thing for Caleb. Josh nodded to himself. He'd bring back Caleb's dad from the dead. Josh thought of how he'd do it and then did it. It wasn't anything glamorous or crazy like a column of lightning, but the mountain had been moved by the faith in Caleb's eyes.

Finally, Josh answered Caleb. Josh pointed across the street, "That's what I mean," he said with a warm smile.

The short redhead looked in the direction Josh indicated and saw something wonderful. Walking across the street was a man dressed in GI military cloths with a backpack over his shoulder. He was the man Josh had seen in Caleb's memory. He was well over 6 feet tall and had red hair like his son. Even in adulthood, he had freckles on his face. Caleb's face lit up as bright as the sun. He looked at Josh in awe before running forth. "Daddy!!" Caleb cried.

Caleb's dad caught his 10-year-old son in a loving embrace long overdue. "Caleb!" he said, "I'm home, son."

"How, daddy?" asked Caleb. The young boy looked up at his towering father.

"It's a long story, son," said Caleb's dad, "what matters now is I'm back." Josh knew. Caleb's dad had been captured instead of killed. The military had listed him as KIA because no terror organization had come forth claiming him in their possession and they never found his remains, taking it that they'd been buried under the sand. Caleb's dad eventually escaped and returned to the States, but word hadn't gotten to Caleb or his mother... until now.

"What about... Marty?" asked Caleb.

"He's been arrested, son," answered the tall red haired man, "We won't be bothered by him anymore and I have more good news! I've bought a nice little house in town, much better then where you're living now. The military's discharged me and an old high school friend of mine hired me. We'll be together, Caleb, my son, a real family again!"

Caleb smiled brightly at this. Josh could feel the overwhelming joy coming from Caleb. It made Josh feel happy that he did something wonderful for someone. He smiled as he watched.

"You didn't introduce me to your friend," said the man suddenly.

"Oh," said Caleb, "this is... uh..."

"Josh," said Josh. He shook the man's hand and caught a glimpse of the man's life. He was a good man and a good dad.

"Nice to meet you, Josh," said the man with a kind smile. He turned to Caleb, "Ready to head back to the house, Caleb? Your mom doesn't have too much to move, but it is a good lot."
1123.title: Caleb's Dad Returns From the Dead

choices: "Let's go over to my friend Ethan's house and make him into an Archangel too!"
"Let's see what more we can do to help the world!"
11232.content:
"Um, dad?" asked Caleb, "Is it alright if I hang out with Josh a little longer?"

Caleb's dad laughed a bit, "I understand, son. You wanna get out of hauling all the stuff from the old house to the new one." He laughed kindly and hugged his son endearingly. Josh knew there was more to it than that, Caleb wanted to get to the bottom of this strange occurence. "Alright. There's not that much stuff, we'll manage. Go ahead and play with your friend, but be home for dinner. I'm taking you two out, you deserve it!"

"Thanks, daddy!" cried Caleb as he hugged his father once more, "I'm so happy you're not dead. You've always been the best daddy in the world. I love you daddy!"

"I love you too, son," said the red haired man. After a while, he left for Caleb's house to help Caleb's mom with the move.

When Caleb's father had gone, Caleb turned finally to Josh. He wasn't doubtful or angry or suspicious. He was in awe. "You did that, didn't you, Josh?" asked Caleb.

"I did do that," replied Josh honestly.

"But... how?" asked Caleb.

Josh approached the next sentance carefully. He wasn't sure how Caleb would take this... "Well, basically," said Josh, "I've been given the powers of God for a Cosmic Day..."

"...Excuse me?" asked Caleb.

Josh didn't want to say that he was God. Josh thought that sounded really selfish to be perfectly honest. He wanted to tell the absolute truth and he did as far as he was concerned. "God gave me His powers to use for a Cosmic Day," repeated Josh.

"Are you joshin' me, Josh?" asked Caleb.

Josh couldn't help but giggle at this for a moment. "No, I'm telling the truth. You believed in me, Caleb. You believed just a little that I could help you and I did, didn't I?"

Caleb looked at Josh, his mouth agap. There was no room for doubt about it. Caleb had seen his father's body and grave when he'd died. None of that was a joke or pretend because they couldn't find his father's real body. This was it, the real deal. Josh had really made it so Caleb's father had never died. "Oh wow," said Caleb, "that's truly amazing, Josh! Thank you for helping me. It was truly wonderful, what you did. I'm honestly eternally grateful."

"You're welcome, Caleb. It was my pleasure. I'm glad you're healing and I'm glad I made you happy again," said Josh with a smile.

"I wish there was something I could do in return, though," said Caleb.

"Just seeing you happy is enough for me," said Josh honestly.

"But I'd like to do more," said Caleb. He sat on the bench again and thought deeply. Josh could see Caleb's great deep mind at work, his essence so pensive and calm. "I know!" said the little redhead as he jumped up. "Let's be friends, Josh!"

Josh smiled. It'd be nice to have a friend. "That'd be awesome, Caleb!" he said with a smile. Caleb grinned. "And I'm going to go even further. Caleb, I'm going to make you an archangel!"

"An Angel?" asked Caleb excitedly, "Really?"

"Just for the Cosmic Day; as long as I barrow God's powers. You have a good heart and a good soul, Caleb, I trust that you'll be an awesome right hand man."

"I... I'll do my best!" said Caleb determinedly.

Josh smiled at this. "Alright... here it goes..." And he did it. Again nothing over-the-top like a bolt of lightning. "There, you're my Archangel."

Caleb looked up at Josh and then looked at the pair of white feathery wings on his shoulders. He'd gained some omnipotence and knew that he could choose who saw or didn't see his wings. Right now only Josh and Caleb could see Caleb's wings. "Wow..." he said, "imagine that, Caleb, the scrawny little redhead, an Archangel."

"You're much more than a scrawny little redhead, Caleb," said Josh, "Don't deny your worth."

Caleb looked up at Josh. "That means a lot to me, thank you," he said, his voice calm and pensive for a ten-year-old. His voice picked up and his eyes lit up once more as he said, "So, what are we gonna do now? We've got the whole afternoon!"

113.title: He tries to avenge Mrs. Reynolds' car

choices: Josh gives Titan and Jason a chance
No chance no  redemption
1131.content:
It all happened in a split second. The two giants known as Titan and Jason, began to shrink at a alarming speed. Their height finally stopped at 5 feet 9 inches, which Josh knew to be the average height for the typical male. Josh, stopping both Titan and Jason’s movements, took a long look at his handiwork, and quite frankly, did not like what he saw. Despite their height Titan and Jason still where quite muscular, this would not stand. Josh wanted them to feel what it was like to be helpless, to be in the position of the weak and powerless, so with great merriment Josh decreed that the two bullies would lose their strength, they would lose their athletic bodies, and as if by magic both Titan and Jason became as skinny as a rail, and as thin as a dinner mint. Josh Smiled as he looked at the two boys who once ruled the neighborhood using nothing but their unstoppable might. Those days were over, Titan and Jason where nothing more than regular kids, regular kids that were still apart of the football team, the wrestling team, plus weights of course. Josh knew that without their muscle, without their height, both Titan and Jason would not be able to keep up with their sports. In the end the sports that Titan and Jason loved so much would be nothing but hell for both of the boys. To make matters worse, or better in Josh’s case, both Titan and Jason had a football game today. Josh would make time to see it of course.

Josh snapping his fingers unfreezes both Titan and Jason, who where still looking at Josh with menacing eyes. It appeared to josh that the two boy did not yet realize their new predicament.

“Wait a minute.” Titan says, looking at Josh with eyes as wide as the church doors.

“Did you get bigger?” Titan asks

Titan and Jason look at Josh with a great amount of confusion.

“AAAAAAAHHHHHHHH!!!!!!!!!!!!!!” Jason screams as he looks at Titan.

“AAAAAAAHHHHHHHH!!!!!!!!!!!!!!” Titan screams as he looks at Jason.

“Man what happened to you?!” Jason yells as he continues to stare at Titan.

“Me? Do what happened to you?!” Titan yells staring at Jason.

Josh roles his eyes 👀. Titan and Jason where not the smartest boys around. Josh knew that he was going to have to give them a little push in the right direction. Josh conjures up a 5ft puddle of crystal clear water 💧 a few feet behind him.

“You guys should probably look at your reflections.” Josh says as he takes a step to his right, revealing the 5ft puddle in all of its glory.

The boys without wasting anymore time sprint over to the puddle that shined when the suns rays stirred its watery surface. Titan and Jason get down on their knees as they gaze into the water, looking at their reflections.

“Dude what happened to us?” Titan asked as he let a few whimpers escape his mouth.

“I don’t know man, we look so weak and helpless.” Jason says as he rubs his thin arms, and stomach.

Titan and Jason’s heart started to break as they looked at their reflections without pause or rest. They, who where once handsome, and had every teenage girl drooling over them, now had average looks, no different than josh’s looks. Titan and Jason, no longer able to bear their shame shut their eyes tight, as tears run down their cheeks.

Josh walks over to the teary eyed boys, feeling a little bad for the plight he had created for them, but deep down Josh knew that he had made the right decision, Titan and Jason we’re getting everything they deserved, and josh wanted both of the bullies to know exactly that.

“Im afraid that tears are not going to solve anything.” Josh says as he stand a few feet away from the weeping boys.

The boys stop crying as they both look at Josh.

“What do you know, you bastard?” Jason says with anger in his voice.

“I know a lot, I’m the one who did this to you after all.” Josh says with a little smirk 😏.

“Y, you did this to use?” Titan says with surprise evident in his voice.

“Yes I did.” Josh says.

“Why you little, Change us back now!” Titan says as he stands up on his feet and rushes towards Josh with his right fist in the air, ready to punch 🤜 his target. Little did he know who that fist was being directed to.

Josh seeing the fist flying right towards his face, stands as still as a statue, with a bored look on his face. Josh wasn’t a fighter, the amount of fights that he had been in, in his whole entire life, he could count on one hand, therefor josh was a little surprised that he wasn’t scared even a little, it was almost like he had been in this situations before. Titans fist moved very slowly, as it made its way towards Josh. Josh with blinding speed catches the fist with his right hand, and holds it tightly, as if it were priceless treasure.

“Let go of me twerp.” Titan says as he pulls and pulls, trying to break away from Josh's iron clad grip, that seemed to keep on getting tighter and tighter.

“I’m coming man!” Jason yells as he runs towards Josh, ready to attack with his fool force.

Josh stares at Jason with eyes as cold as ice, and as sharp like daggers. Jason stops moving once again, not because Josh had paralyzed him, it because he was to afraid to move. Jason felt cold and empty, as he stared into Josh’s eyes. Jason wasn’t the only one who felt this overwhelming force. Titan could also feel it, his body not being able to stop shaking as he looked at Josh, like he was looking at a monster, a monster born from evil. Titan and Jason for a brief moment could have sworn that they saw a skeleton behind them, breathing down their necks.

‘‘Am I going to die’’ the two boy thought as they looked at Josh with fear in their eyes.

As josh stared at the two boys, he did not know that for a split nano second his eyes had glowed a crimson red, a crimson red like blood.

Josh soon realizes that the boys had stopped moving and soon starts to relax, as he lets go of Titans hand. Upon releasing Titans hand, Titan falls to the ground, his eyes still locked on Josh. Jacob remained standing, even though it took all of his strength to do so

“This is what you guys deserve, don’t ever forget you guys did this to yourself.” Josh says as he starts to walk away.

“Wait please their has to be something that we can do to return to our regular forms.” Titan pleads as he gets on his knees as if he were going to beg.

Josh stops walking as he thinks about Titans words. Josh had grown up believing that people can change for the better. God doesn’t forsake people, god sure as hell didn’t forsake him, so did he have a right to forsake other people. Josh turns around and looks at Titan and Jason.

(What does Josh decide?)
1131.title: he shrinks them to average height & muscle size...

11311.content:
Eyes are a gateway to the soul. Josh finally understood the meaning to those words as he looked the two bullies, known as Titan and Jason, in the eyes, eyes that revealed a whole entire story, to all those able to read them. A story of fear, anger, embarrassment, and yet hope, all of these feelings were made evident to Josh, and yet none of these emotions satisfied him, none of these emotions were what he was looking for. Yet Josh couldn’t help his own feeling, emanating within him. He might in the future come to regret his decision, but still he wanted to give the two bullies a chance. Josh was a god fearing man after all, and wasn’t this what god expected when it came to his children?

“Alright I’ll give you another chance.” Josh says with a small smile, that manages to put both Titan and Jason at ease.

“Thank you Josh.” Titan says, still on his knees, but with happiness bows his head in appreciation.

“Yea thank you josh, we’ll do anything you ask of us, but please turn us back to normal.” Jason say following Titans lead as he gets on his knees and bowing his head in respect.

“I’ll turn you back to normal, but only if you both manage to pass my test.” Josh says with a perky attitude.

“Test, what test?” Titan asks with a determination, you never thought you would see from someone like him.

Both boys listen carefully not wanting to miss even one word that came out of your mouth.

“The test is simple, just prove to me that you both have changed for the better. Do this and I’ll restore you both to your original forms.” Josh says.

The boys after hearing your condition, stare at each other for a few seconds before their eyes shift back to you with excitement fueling their sense of purpose, and a mutual goal giving them both the courage to move forward.

“Ok that should be easy.” Titans says.

“Yea very easy.” Jason follows suite as he voices his own opinion.

Both boys merely saw this test as something to do, in order to pass the time. They didn’t see it as a obstacle, but a steady path, that could be easily traversed. Only Josh knew better.

“So just tell us what we have to do in order to prove that we are changed people, in your eyes.” Titans says with both hands on his head as he stares at Josh.

Josh closes his eyes in disappointment, it was just as he had expected. Both Titan and Jason didn’t truly understand what this test was about, and yet josh still believed that they could succeed. It if they were to succeed they would have to do so alone.

“I think you know what you need to do Titan.” Josh says with a small smile.

“No I don’t, that’s why I’m asking.” Titan says, feeling a little worried. Jason shaking his head in agreement.

“Look you two, this is not new stuff. It is written down in books, scrolls, and even stone tablets. What I require from the both of you is not something hard or impossible, but something necessary.” Josh says with a serious tone.

“Please Josh can you at least give us a hint?” Titan asks, the little bit of hope he had disappearing away, like water down a drain.

“Sorry, you boys are on your own. Do not disappoint me.” Josh says.

Within a few seconds josh was covered by a blinding white light that made both Titan and Jason turn away to shield their eyes from the lights harmful raise. The light like a ghost vanishes into thin air, and Titan and Jason soon realize that Josh along with the light is now no where to be found. Titan and Jason couldn’t even begin to understand the phenomenon that had happened right in front of their eyes, but they didn’t concern themselves with the supernatural occurrence. They had a test to pass, and a football game that was about to start in a few minutes.

Little did the boys know that josh had teleported himself on top of the school building, looking down on them like a bird of prey.

Josh knew that he was doing the right thing, giving both Titan and Jason a chance. Josh truly believed that everyone had the right to have the chance to change for the better, and right now he was giving the two most feared bullies in the neighborhood to do exactly that. Deep down josh wished he could say that, helping the two bullies change for the better was the only reason he decided to give them another chance. But to bad the truth was never that simple or easy. Josh thought back to the time he had engaged both Titan and Jason in a quick fight, grabbing Titans hand with ease, stopping Jason with nothing but a glare powerful enough to scare the most dangerous animal, and of course how all of this came so natural to him, like he had done it a thousand times before. Josh thought about all of these factors that had transpired between him and the two bullies, and quite frankly he was scared, scared not of fighting, or of putting those bullies in their place, but of his powers. Josh thinking back to when he had given Jason his death glare. Josh at that moment had felt it, something dark, something evil.

“That can’t be possible, these powers come from god, and god is pure good. Isn’t he?” Josh asks a little confused.

(Later at night)

Both Titan and Jason are inside the boys locker room, getting ready to play their football game. Both where still scrawny little kids, their teammates towering over them made that self evident. To both of the boys surprise no one had looked at them funny, nor where any of their teammates or even friends shocked to find both Titan and Jason shrunk to such weak and pathetic forms (thanks to Josh of course), instead everyone treated both Titan and Jason as if they where normal. But their was a new major difference. Titan and Jason where now the punching bags of the whole team, each of their teammates bullying them in one way or another. Titans and Jason had never been so humiliated in their whole entire lives.

The football game had finally started. It was the Black Hawks vs the Lion Backs, each school doing everything necessary to win. Josh sitting on the stands with hundreds of other parents and students watch as the seemingly bad game becomes worse. The Black Hawks that represented Josh’s school were losing by a extreme large margin. They where down by 20 points and it was all because of two people. Titans and Jason.

Titans and Jason where making a mess out on the field. They kept on Dropping the Ball 🏈, getting passes intercepted by the other team, getting tackled very quickly, and even missing passes that were quite easy to make. Titans and Jason where the worse players that many people had Seen, and many people where left asking “why hasn’t the coach taken them out yet.” The answer to this question was simple. Josh was manipulating events behind the scenes, making it so that both Titan and Jason got a lot of playing time to embarrass themselves. Josh hated to admit it but he was having fun making a fool out of the two bullies

It was now the forth Quarter of the foot ball game, and every one knew who the winner was going to be. The Black Hawks had only scored 5 points the whole game. To say that everyone was pissed was a understatement. Josh looking out onto the filled see’s Titan with the ball running down the field with all of his strength, Jason right beside him for support. Josh had to hand it to the two boys, they had courage and spunk, to bad that wasn’t what josh was looking for. The crowd cheered as Titan miraculously made his way down the field, he was so Close to a touchdown, not like it would change anything.

“Bang!” Titans and Jason are tackled down to the ground by huge football players who completely dwarfed them in size.

The crowd soon goes quit as everyone’s hopes are completely crushed. Josh couldn’t help but wonder what Titan and Jason where thinking, so he decided to use his powers to read their minds.

Titan: “I cant believe that this is happening to me, how could I fill so weak.”

Jason: “Oh man I’m so embarrassed, how am I supposed to show my face around school now?”

Josh wasn’t surprised to see how both of the bullies where only thinking about themselves, and it made Him a little angry to see how little they had changed. But then something happened, something that surprised him.

Titan: “I wonder is this how, the people we messed with felt when we were picking on them?”

Jason: “Did I inflict this exact pain on other people?”

To Josh’s surprise both titans and Jason’s thoughts started to shift towards other people. Josh looking into the minds of both Titan and Josh could see images, images of the people both Titan and Jason had bullied over the years.

Titan: “To every person I’ve bullied.....”

Jason: “To every last person I’ve hurt......”

Titan/Jason: “IM SORRY.”

Josh had his mouth wide open, in surprise and shock. Did he just hear what he thought he heard? Titans and Jason had actually done it. They had passed the test. They had now felt the one emotion that Josh wanted them to feel.... guilt.

“You guys have.....”
11311.title: Josh’s test, the Guilty will be Forgiven

113112.content:
Josh with content closes his eyes, and with a small smile on his face, nods his head in acceptance. The test had been passed, and both Titan and Jason had become better people because of their profound realization. It wasn’t all about them, other people no matter how small, no matter how weak, mattered, and now that they finally understood that, their was no longer any reason to torture them any further.

Josh concentrates on both boys, wishing from the deepest depths of his heart that everything changed would be restored. Josh’s eyes flutter open to reveal the golden glow that they both produced with great intensity. Powerful waves of golden energy envelope the whole field, covering every single person in a warm yet powerful embrace. Josh, the focal point of this other worldly phenomena look at both Titan and Jason with pride and joy, and let’s out a small whisper as soft as a spring breeze, that echoes in the minds of both of the boys.

“Well done.”

As if on cue both Titan and Jason returned to their old muscular selfs. The golden energy as well as Josh had completely disappeared with out a trace. Titan and Jason lying on the ground, look up at the night sky 🌌. The game was over their team had suffered a unbearable loss that would haunt the boys for the rest of their lives, and yet both boys felt content. Without a doubt they would remember this test and of course Josh as well who was their judge 👨‍⚖️, jury, and yet their last hope. Soon both boys got up from off the grassy ground and started to walk towards the boys locker rooms to change and reflect on their past actions.

“Titan.” Jason says.

“Yea?” Titans asks looking at Jason, who refused to look at him.

“We’re assholes.” Jason says bluntly.

“Yea.” Titans says with a little laugh 😂.

“Titan.” Jason says again.

“Yea?” Titans responds, this time reverting his gaze away from Jason.

“I want to change.” Jason says with determination.

“Yea.... me to buddy.” Titans says as I’d he where making a oath to himself.

Both boys shined with determination as they walked off the field to join their fellow teammates in the locker rooms. Little did both boys realize that they where being watched by Josh who was floating right above the Football field. Josh thought about the test he has subjected both Titan and Jason to. Deep down Josh wasn’t sure if he was doing the right thing, but seeing the results reassured him that maybe he had made the right call.

“Well I guess it is time to go home and get some rest.” Josh says.

Almost immediately after finishing his sentence, josh is covered by a blinding white light, and disappears from above the football field and reappears inside his room. Josh lived in a two story house, that had three bedrooms, and two bathrooms, one up stares and one down stares. Josh lived here with his single mother who’s name was Bethany Strange, who was not home at the moment. Bethany was working late tonight and therefore at the moment Josh had the entire house to himself. Their where two bedrooms up stairs. Josh’s room was the room closet to the bathroom, while the other room remained empty. Bethany’s room was downstairs right next to the stair case, with the door completely closed. Bethany always had a habit of closing her doors when ever she left the house. To this day Josh never understood why.

Josh in his room hops on top of his bed, with both of his hands folded behind his head. Josh lost in thought stares at the ceiling. Josh couldn’t believe how strange today had been. Today was the day that Josh had essentially become god. But their was still one lingering question that plagued Josh’s mind.

“Why me?” Josh thought out loud.

This question would continue to echo inside of Josh’s head, until he finally fell asleep 😴.

(Miles away in a open field, covered in lush grass)

The sky was dark, and was filled with a myriad of stars ✨. The sound of crickets, and the chirping of birds filled the air, as if they were singing to celebrate this lovely night that the full moon eliminated from above.

The singing abruptly stops and the whole falls under a ghostly silence.

The ground begins to rumble. The wind scatters in all directions, blowing through the grass lands, and through the many trees that stood in the distance, with strength that seemed to only increase as time passed. The night sky soon begins to brighten as something falls from the very heavens. Something on fire 🔥 as if it where a miniature sun. If one where to see it, they would confuse it as some kind of meteor that was about to make contact with the earth. It was no meteor.

“BOOM!!!!!”

A massive shockwave envelops the whole grassy area, uplifting the ground destroying countless trees, and turning any living animal to ash. Smoke and dust filled the air, making it almost impossible to see anything. Soon the smoke and dust vanish to reveal a sight most would believe impossible. The field that was once covered in grass was now completely destroyed, the very ground was singed as if it had been incinerated by a super powerful flame thrower. Their where hardly any threes still standing, and those that where still upright had no leafs left on their branches.

In the middle of the field rested a massive crater that covered a large majority of the field. In the middle stood a women.

The women had long red hair tied in a ponytail, that came down to her legs. The women had flawless white skin that glistened in the moonlight. The women also had azure blue eyes that made her look almost other worldly. The women wore battle armor that made her look like a Amazonian warrior. The women had sliver battle gauntlets that covered her arms, silver chest armor, sliver shin guards that came up to her knees leaving the rest of her legs bare, on top of the women’s head was a sliver head band with a strange branding the rested in the middle, and at her side rested a sword with a golden hilt.

The women steps out of the crater and after doing so stand completely still, like a beautiful statue.

“It’s time to begin my mission.” The women finally says after a few minutes.

“God I will find you.”

1131121.content:
“DID IT FEEL GOOD?”

Josh standing in a dark open space, hears a voice that echoes all around him. A voice that sent a chill down his spine.

“What?” Josh asks confused.

“I ASKED DID IT FEEL GOOD?” The mysterious voice asks again with even more intensity than before.

Josh looking around his dark surroundings could not see any signs of life, their was only a ever expanding darkness.

“Did what feel good?” Josh asks.

“DID OT FEEL GOOD TO PUNISH THOSE MERE MORTALS.” The voice says with a sign of happiness in its tone.

Josh didn’t know what to say, where was this voice coming from and why did this voice make him feel uncomfortable.

“Of course it didn’t feel good.” Josh said with certainty in his voice.

“OH COME NOW DON’T LIE, DIDNT IT FEEL GREAT TO PUT THOSE BULLYS IN THEIR PLACE, LIKE SOME KIND OF GOD.” The voice once again speaks from the darkness.

“No I did what I had to do because it was right, in the name of god it was the right thing to do. I gave those bully’s the chance to change their ways, to do good, because if I am a god, I wish to be a benevolent god.” Josh says with a serious tone.

Josh didn’t know who this voice emanated from but he would not let it change him, he stood his ground holding true to his ideals.

“YOU SPEAK WITH SUCH PRETTY WORDS, TO BAD THEY ARE WORDS HIDDEN IN LIES AND DECEIT.” The voice says in mockery.

“That’s it who are you, stop hiding in the shadows and face me!” Josh shouts in anger.

“YOU WISH FOR ME TO REVEAL MYSELF, WELL ALL YOU HAD TO DO WAS ASK.”

The whole area becomes deathly quite.

“Is this to your liking?”

Josh turns around and sees something that completely shocks him.

“Your, your me....” josh says as he stares at a complete copy of himself, except this copy had a few changes.

The copy had pure black hair, unlike Josh’s hair which was blond. The copies eyes where pitch black and it’s skin was as white as snow. The copy wore delinquent black close which looked very awkward to Josh seeing as to how he was looking at his own copy wearing them.

“Oh I wouldn’t say I’m you.” The copy says with a wicked smile.

“If your god then I would be your anti- god.” The copy says

“Ok first of all I wouldn’t say I’m a god, second of all what’s a anti-god?” Josh asks curiously.

“That’s not important, what is important is that you better get used to your station in life, and you better get used to it quickly.” The copy says turning his back from you, walking away.

“Who are you really?” Josh asks not trusting this copy, even for a minute.

“You will soon see little god when the time comes you will soon see, until then you need to be prepared. Their coming for you.” The copy says with that creepy smile.

“Who’s coming for........” josh stops talking as his surrounding begin to shake rapidly.

“What’s happening?!” Josh asks feeling startled 😮.

“Looks like it’s time for you to go.” The copy says staring at josh with its dark eyes.

Without warning josh begins to fall into the abyss. Josh looking up sees his dark copy above him, getting further and further away.

“Continue to survive my other self, survive until your body becomes.......”

Josh could no longer hear the copy as he grew further and further away from him. Soon the copy faded away in the darkness.

Josh opens is eyes, staring at a ceiling that the suns rays illuminated.

“It was all a dream.” Josh says feeling a little relief. “Nothing but a dream.”

Josh gets out of bed and with a snap of his fingers a white t-shirt, and black jean pants appear on his body.

“Was it just a dream though?” Josh asks himself thinking back to what had happened a few minute ago.

Josh couldn’t help but think that, that so called dream was a precursor of thing yet to come.

“I need to get out of here.” Josh says to himself

With nothing but a thought josh teleports to the neighborhood park. It was early in the morning so not a lot of people were at the park at the moment. Josh walks down a path that went straight through the park. Josh walks down the path thinking of his life, the powers he welded, and the dream he had last night.

“What did he mean when he said the they were coming?” Josh asks no one in particular, thinking about the warnings his clone gave him.

“Who’s coming?” Josh asks very confused.

Josh still walking through the park sees something that breaks him out of his train of thought. Josh sees Titan and Jason cleaning Mrs. Reynolds car 🚘. The car that was pretty beat up was now looking much better. Mrs. Reynolds was looking at the two boys with a smile on her face as she sits down on a wooden bench.

Josh smiles as he stares at the two old bullies with a sense of pride.

“I did the right thing.” Josh thinks to himself as he thinks back to the dream.

“I did not feel good about what I did but it was still necessary.” Josh thinks continue if his walk through the park.

“BOOM!!!!!” a huge explosion erupts throughout the park as something lands from the sky, lands right in front of Josh. Trees and chunks of rock and dirt go flying through the sky as the shock wave of the explosion throws Josh off his feet. Black smoke and dirt make it almost impossible for anyone to see anything.

“What in the world is happening.” Josh says looking at the explosion right before his eyes as a radiant light appear in the Epicenter. Josh's head was filled with questions, what was happening now? The only good thing right now was that their was no one around the area currently but that would soon change.

As time passes the black smoke ant the wild dirt begins to disappear, and the light soon begins to weaken.

Josh soon sees something in the middle of the explosion a women with red long hair that was in a ponytail. The women wore silver battle armor with a sword at her side. The women stood inside of a deep crater and as time passes her gaze shifts towards you

“You!!!!” The women shouts with rage.

You stand on your two feet and begin to back away.

“Prepare yourself devil, justice is here.”

“Oh god what now.”

You didn’t know who this women was but you hope she wasn’t going to be the one who takes your life.”

11311211.content:
Josh had never before been on the wrong side of a sword, in fact Josh had never been on the wrong side of any weapon, what could he say, he was a good boy. To bad today was the day that, that would all change for Josh as a women with long red hair and sparkling sliver armor pointed a sword right at his neck.

In truth the women was so beautiful to Josh, that Josh had almost forgot about the sword pointed right at his neck. Josh looking at the women see’s that she had the most beautiful white skin that he had ever seen. The women’s hair was in a pony tail and was the longest hair that Josh had ever seen, for it went down all the way to her knees. The women smelled like a dozen flowers and gave off a welcoming aura that made people want to get close to her. Josh was no different as he took a step forward, walking right into the tip of the women’s sword. Josh, feeling the cold tip of fine steel snaps out of his day dreaming, and looks at the sword with panic.

“E, excuse me ma’am.” Josh says, making sure to be as polite as he possibly to the crazy women with the weapon.

“Please tell me, what have I done to deserve such treatment?” Josh asks putting both. Hands up defensively.

Josh looking at the women sees her squint her eyes in suspicion.

“Do not try to deceive me fiend!” The women yells with eyes filled with pure hatred.

“Thou are obviously a demon sent to the world of men to spread your vile and deceit!” The women says as she swings her sword towards Josh's neck.

Josh quickly ducks down, dodging the sword and jumps back to gain distance.

“Please ma’am calm yourself.” Josh says trying to calm the women down.

Josh didn’t know what the lady meant when she said that he was a demon, nor did Josh know why the women was speaking so strangely but he knew he would find out soon.

“Thou is quick, but I am quicker demon!” The women says as she speeds at Josh with blinding speed.

Josh only had a few seconds to react as the sword arch’s towards his face. Josh quickly jumps in the air, just barely missing the silver sword, which makes contact with the hard ground. Josh floats in the air as a shock wave pushes against his body.

“BOOM!”

Dirt fills the air and the wind blows fiercely all around the area. It doesn’t take long for the dust and dirt to clear and the wind to start to return to normal. Josh who’s vision, no longer obstructed by the flying rubble sees the ground totally decimated, and the sword that caused all of the destruction didn’t even have a little scratch on it. Josh knew at that moment that this women wasn’t some kind of cause play person, no she was dead serious. She wanted to kill him.

“Thou has some skill.” The women says with a small smile on her face as she looks at Josh with excitement.

“Have I, found a worthy opponent?” The girl asks walking towards Josh who still floats in the air.

“Whoever you are, I ask that you please stop this.” Josh says with worry in his eyes.

“Please walk away, and remember that he who lives by the sword will die by the sword.” Josh says hoping to stop a fight before it began.

“Quoting the words of our lord, thou truly are foolish for a demon.” The women says with a serious tone in her voice.

“Please we don’t have to...”

“Hold your tongue vile thing!!!” The women screams cutting Josh off.

“Expect the judgement of thy lord, and perish into the light.” The women says pointing her blade at Josh.

Josh and the strange women look at each other for a few minutes and without warning, both move with lightning Speed. The women flys towards Josh, sword in hand.

“Be destroyed, devil!” The women yells as she swings her sword at Josh.

Josh seeing the attack coming creates a blue energy force field that stops the sword in its tracks. The wind once again rages all around these two super powered beings as they fight each other. The women continues to attack Josh’s force field, each attack getting stronger and stronger. Josh having enough of the assault puts up and spreads his right hand towards the women, still safe inside the forcefield. The women lost in her constant attacks soon fills a powerful force push her towards the ground.

“Boom!” The women falling to the ground creates a small crater. The women wasn’t down for long, as she stands up with hardly any scratches on her body. Both Josh and the women wast no time as they fly towards each other at blinding speed.

“BOOM!!!” Visible shock waves emanate all around the two warriors as they clash with one another. The ground was torn apart, trees were ripped from the ground and people took cover as if they were in the middle of a war zone, all of this from a women and boy fighting with one another.

Josh held tightly to both of the women’s hand, Josh couldn’t help but look into the women’s azure blue eyes, that seemed to shine with power. He didn’t want this fight, he didn’t ask for it, but deep down he knew it couldn’t continue.

Josh feels the energy inside his body grow stronger. It rushes through his vanes, making him feel invincible. Josh’s blue eyes turn bright gold as he looks at his opponent who seemed to be looking at him with complete shock. Josh still holding both of the women’s hands pulls with Herculean strength, and without effort spins the women around in circles (picture Gokus dragon throw). Josh soon lets go and the women goes flying through a dozen trees, snapping them in half and making a huge trench in the ground.

Josh lands in the middle of the park and slowly looks around. The park was ruined people were hurt. All of this was caused because of him and that women’s foolishness. Josh walks towards the women who was still laying on the ground. Josh had questions, like who was she, why did she attack him, why did she call him demon, and would she go out on a date with him.

Josh stood before the women, who was still laying on the ground. The women looked like she had seen better days, her red hair was no longer in a ponytail and looked a mess, with leaves and twigs inside it. Her skin was a little bruised and something was dripping from her small cuts, something shining with a golden luster.

Josh looking at her for a few second soon offers her a hand up.

“You ok?” Josh asks hoping to be done with this fight.”

The women looks at the hand as if it were a strange species of animal, and with a long sigh accepts Josh’s gesture of good Will.

“Sooo, are we done fighting?” Josh asks completely ready for an attack.

“Yes Thou have bested me in mortal combat, and I ask for thy forgiveness.” The women says bowing her head.

Josh looks at the women in shock, was it really over just like that.

“N, no problem.” Josh says with an awkward laugh.

“Sooo, you mind telling me what you are?” Josh asks.

Josh knew that this women couldn’t be human, he would have to be a idiot to think other wise.

The women looks at Josh with eyes that could pierce the soul, it kind of made Josh a little uncomfortable. The women soon closes her eyes, Josh almost thought that the women wouldn’t answer his question.

“I’m an angel of the lord.”The women says looking at Josh.

“Wait what?”

1133.content:
Josh just folded his arms and stared at the two large football players while maintaining a grin on his face. The two men just laughed it off, until Titan stopped and started walking towards him, flexing his arms and cracking his knuckles.

Josh just remained very calm. Little did Titan and Jason realize that they had threatened the most powerful boy in the entire universe.

"I command Titan and Jason to shrink to six inches and to lose all their muscles!" Josh said calmly, but loud enough for the two to hear.

"Jason! Did you hear THAT?" Titan laughed loudly. "The kid thinks we're gonna shr--"

Suddenly, Both Titan and Jason felt an odd feeling like pins-and-needles, which raged through their bodies from head to toe! Then, just as the omnipotent boy had commanded, the two football jocks began to SHRINK! They looked at each other and realized that the hallway, the lockers, and the doors to the classrooms appeared to be getting bigger and BIGGER! And it was happening very QUICKLY!

"TITAN! Does everything appear to be growing for you???" Jason gasped, as the big jock dwindled down to 5 ft 7 inches.

"YES! DUDE! What the HELL!!!" Titan gasped, as he continued to shrink.

13.content:
Josh watched Father Williams lock up the church. Still dressed in his white altar-boy robes, Josh started off home. He thought about the boy he met in church. The one with the black hair. What was it he said? Josh was now God with the power to do ANYTHING he wanted?

Josh thought about this and a shiver raced through his body. The power to...Josh shook himself. That was ridiculous! The kid was obviously some kind of looney. The power to do WHATEVER he wanted!? Josh scoffed and continued walking. He stopped at the corner and stared at the street ahead. He pressed the crossing-button and waited as traffic rushed past. Josh checked his watch. It was nearly time for his favourite cartoon show!

"Oh come on!!" he groaned. He could do the four-block dash easily...If the freakin' lights would turn green! And stay that way all the way home!

"Paaaauuurrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrr!!!"

The buzzer went off and Josh sprinted across the street! He dashed down the block and skidded to a halt at the next one! There was an electronic bleep and another loud buzzing noise as the next signal went off! Josh kept running! He sprinted right through the third intersection as the walk-signal went off there as well! He ran across the last intersection and skidded to a halt in front of his house! He checked his watch.

Five minutes.

No way!

Josh pulled out his keys and unlocked the front door.

"Mommah!" he called out, "Mommah! I'm home!"

Josh's mother, a sweet-looking woman who loved cooking, stuck her head out from around a doorway.

"Hey sweetums!" she called, "Your favourite show's on soon! But you better go wash all that candlesmoke out of your hair first!"

"Yeah momma!" said Josh. He sprinted upstairs. He stripped off his robes and pulled on a T-shirt and a pair of slacks and sprinted downstairs again!

"Josh! No running in the house!" his mother called after him.

"But momma! Ben 10's about to..."
"I don't care if they're launching the new movie-length premiere! NO RUNNING!"
"Sorry momma..."

Josh sighed. He headed to the couch and sat down. He turned on the TV in the living-room.

Miiiaaaooow

"Hey Munchie!"

A fat, yellow and white cat jumped onto Josh's lap and rested its head on his thigh. Suddenly, two smaller cats jumped onto his lap as well!

"Hey Friskers! Hey Fuzzles!...Heeey that tickles!" Josh giggled as the two kittens nuzzled him playfully. "Munchie! Tell Frisky and Fuzzies to stop nuzzling me! It tickles!"

The two baby kittens miaowed at their mother and curled up in Josh's lap.

"Awww...wook ad yoooouuu..." Josh said, stroking the cats playfuly "Adooorable widdle fuzzlebawllz..."

At the first commercial-break, Josh got up and headed to the kitchen for a snack. He closed the fridge-door to see Munchie, Friskers and Fuzzles at his feet.

"Huh?" he thought. He headed back to the TV. The cats followed him. Josh sat down. The cats jumped onto the couch. Josh moved to one side...the cats followed him. Josh moved to the other side of the couch. The cats followed him again.

"What the heck is going on here..." Josh thought. He stood up and backed away to the kitchen door. The cats followed him!

"Uuuh, Munchie...I...I know you all like me and stuff and I love you too...but...You don't have to follow me everywhere..."

The cat miaowed mournfully.

"Oh okay..."

The cat miaowed and nuzzled him. Josh smiled.

After dinner, Josh headed upstairs. He needed to relax. This had been a weird day.

1313.content:
Josh just smiled as he sat on his bed with his back leaning against the stack of pillows. As he closed his eyes, a flood of prayers came in. He heard each one of them in his mind, as they originated from all over the world.

Finally, he heard the three that he wanted to focus on. It came from a high school student who was frequently bullied in school. The student hung out with his friend, who was also a nerd. So, Josh snapped his fingers and teleported to the school in England, appearing at the school. He was completely invisible so nobody could see him.

Paul was walking down the hallway with Simon, his best friend. Paul was the 15-year-old who had said the prayer just as he walked into the schoolyard. He was often bullied for being so skinny, short and smart. Simon was the same way, but he was a little taller. Simon had just started lifting weights in the gym, but he wasn’t muscular at all.

“Mate, I wish we knew someone who could protect us from the bigger dudes!” Paul grumbled. “I have too much homework to waste my time in a gym!”

“Uhh right… I just started lifting weights, mate…” Simon sighed. “It will take me at least three years before I see any significant gains!”

“Maybe we should just pay the big guys to leave us alone?” Paul grumbled. “I don’t know where I’ll get the money from!”

Simon was about to respond when they walked past the bathroom.

“Uhh…. I need to use the toilet, mate…. Give me a minute!” Simon said as he walked into the boy’s bathroom. He had no idea that Josh had caused his bladder to fill up quickly.

Once inside, the tall but skinny boy used the stall real quick before he came out to the sink to wash his hands.

While he stood there, ready to dry his hands under the hand dryer, he was overcome by a powerful, tingling sensation which coursed all through his slender body. Then, without warning, his every muscle on his muscle started to inflate, all at the same time! Within seconds, Simon morphed from a tall, skinny kid to a very athletic young man as his arms bulged, his chest inflated, and his torso widened. His quads widened considerably, and his calves bulged into soccer balls. Luckily, thanks to Josh’s powers, his clothing and his shoes grew along with him as his muscles expanded rapidly.

When it was all over, Simon remained standing there, glancing at his reflection in the mirror. His jaw dropped open when he realized how he had changed. Gone was the tall, skinny guy. In his place was now a big, athletic, teenage bodybuilder with thick pecs and vein-covered biceps, quads and calves!

“What the hell happened?” Simon gasped as he posed and turned sideways, flexing his arms. He couldn’t believe what he was seeing. It was as if he had been working out in the gym for years!

Just then, the door to the bathroom opened. It was Paul.

“Yo, Simon! Are you coming, mate?”

“Yeah! I’m here!”

Simon joined Paul and the two boys walked back to class. Nobody had said anything about Simon’s weird growth spurt. It was as if he had always been that way. And, Josh just looked on from a distance, smiling quietly, before he teleported back to his bedroom.

1321.content:
That afternoon, when Josh woke up from his nap, he heard his mother gathering some papers and books in the kitchen. As he looked over, his cat jumped on top of him, and couldn't stop licking his hand.

"What is it, Munchie? Do you need more food? More water in your bowl?" he said, as he looked over at the two empty bowls on the floor. He felt so nice and comfortable, he just didn't feel like getting up. "Oh man... I wish Munchie's bowls were filled already..."

Then, when Josh looked up, suddenly, a fresh serving of cat food magically appeared in the bowl, and the other bowl was filled to the rim with fresh drinking water!

Josh finally got up and walked over to the kitchen where his mother had just finished carrying several bags of groceries from the car into the house and set them on the kitchen counter.

"What's this? What are all these books?" Josh said, as he saw a stack of books on the table.

"Those are Bibles and lesson books. There is a midweek church service with Father William" his mother explained. "Would you want to go to that?"

"Sure!" Josh replied.

"Could you help put the groceries away while I change?" his mom asked, as she walked towards her bedroom, leaving Josh alone in the kitchen.

"Wow... I wish all these groceries were neatly put away in the fridge and cupboards already..." Josh sighed. Instantly, all the bags of groceries had disappeared and everything was neatly stored away in the cupboards, in the pantry, and in the fridge, just as Josh had commanded.

"That was so cool!" Josh grinned, as he began to grasp the extent of his powers, as Munchie continued to walk right in front of him, rubbing her fur against his legs. "What is it, huh? You haven't left me alone all day!"

Just then, his mother came out of the bedroom and signaled to Josh that she was ready to go to church. Josh got in the car, and his mom got behind the wheel. Moments later, they were on their way!

When they arrived at the church, people were just getting ready for service. Josh sat all the way in the front row, when Father William came up and lead the congregation in an opening prayer. As he completed the prayer and everyone said Amen, Josh said to himself "I heard your prayers!" just loud enough for the priest to hear it.

The priest then gave a short lesson before a girl lead the group with a few songs before a closing prayer, where at the end, Josh repeated the same thing out loud. The priest looked up and wondered why Josh said that.

Finally, when the service was over, the priest walked up to the entrance near the back of the hall. When Josh came out, he looked down on the boy and asked him "Why did you give such an unusual response after the prayer?"

"Because... I heard all your prayers!" Josh shrugged.

"Only God can hear all our prayers, my boy!" the priest answered.

"Well... " Josh whispered. "I am God..."

"What? My boy... How can you say that?" Father William asked the boy.

"I hear your prayers! ALL of them! You prayed for Mrs. James this morning and Deacon Johanson this afternoon and Mr. Burns, who was sick and also you prayed with Father Jenkins just before the service!" Josh said with a grin on his face. "I heard all of it!"

"Oh... my... God..." Father William said, as he stepped back.

"That's me!" Josh grinned.

"Yes... Josh... You... You're my Lord, my God... In the body of a little boy!"

The priest then came closer to Josh and embraced the boy...

133.content:
Josh just loved Sunday evenings. He could pretty much do whatever he wanted. He went to church in the morning, where he served as the altar boy during the mass. Then, he had lunch after the mass, and afterwards he would hang out with friends or else he would just watch TV or play video games at home. His mom would often work at the clothing store in the shopping mall, so he would frequently be home alone. His best friend, Ethan, wasn't always home either, so it all depended on what was going on and who was available to hang out with him if he was alone or not after mass.

It was getting rather cloudy outside and Josh still had some homework left to do math class, so he wandered over to his desk and sat down at his chair. He turned on his laptop and pulled up the website for his elementary school, where he saw that he needed to finish up some work on some math problems. He finally got his book out of his backpack and started writing in his notebook, when something caught his eye.

His little goldfish, Sharky, was constantly swimming over to one side of the small fishbowl, facing Josh. The bowl was placed near the edge of the desk, and Josh usually saw Sharky swimming around in the small bowl. This time, however, the little fish appeared to be hovering around the same area, facing the boy.

"What's the matter? Didn't I feed you this morning?" Joshua wondered out loud.

Josh took the small plastic jar with fish food, containing dry flakes with food, and sprinkled some of it into the water. Little Sharky swam to the surface and ate some of it, before descending down to about halfway into the bowl, so it could stare at the human being who sitting in front of him. Obviously to the fish, it was looking out over the LORD who sat before him, and it was eager to worship its God.

Josh did another row of math problems, until he was finished. Then he put down his pen and closed his notebook, when he realized that his fish was still looking straight at him.

"What's the matter? You look so sad in the little bowl..." Josh sighed. "I bet you'd be a lot happier if your bowl were twice as big!"

Suddenly, the glass bowl GREW until it was exactly TWICE as big as before! Just as Josh had suggested! Not only that, but the bowl magically filled up to the rim with water, providing twice as much room for little Sharky as before!

Sharky swam around the larger bowl twice, circling around the glass, before coming back to the side facing Josh!

"Whoa!" Josh gasped, as he got up from his chair! "Waiiiiiittt a minute.... How... What... This is weird! REALLY, really weird!"

Josh stood there for a moment and stared at the larger fish bowl, which sat on his desk. He stepped back, not knowing what to think of the strange, magical transformation which had just taken place. Did HE just do that? What had just taken place? What happened? How did he do that?

As Josh took another step back, he bumped into his chair, and fell backwards! His chair suddenly grew longer and wider, morphing into a large, comfortable recliner chair, which broke his fall! For a moment, Josh lay there, which his back in the super-comfortable recliner chair, which had replaced his small office chair.

The strange chair freaked him out again!

"Whhaaaaaahh!" Where did that chair come from??" Josh exclaimed, as he leaped from the chair and got back on his feet.

Then he took another step back, and bumped into the edge of his bed. Once again, the boy lost his balance, and fell with his back on his small bed. But, his bed was no longer just an ordinary bed. His bed suddenly morphed into a King-sized giant waterbed, which suddenly began to make sloshing noises due to the water splashing against the inner lining of the bed. Josh's body rocked up-and-down like a boat on the water.

"Whooaaa! This is comfortable!!" he grinned, as he lay on his huge waterbed, which was covered with silk sheets and covers, along with ten big, fluffy pillows everywhere! "This bed is made for a King!"

Josh bounced around his huge, super-comfortable bed for a few minutes, until he got tired of it. Then, he decided to crawl to the edge, so he could get off. He walked back to his desk, where he looked at his large fishbowl once again.

"Mom is gonna FREAK when she sees this huge fishbowl! It needs to shrink back to how it was before!" he whispered.

The large fishbowl did exactly that: It shrunk back to the original size! Unfortunately, the large bowl was filled with fresh water, so when it shrunk, the excess water began to spill out over the upper edge of the bowl, spilling all over the edge of the desk and on to the hardwood floor of Josh's bedroom!

"Oh NO!" Josh gasped, when he saw the water spill all over the floor. "No, no, no, Nooo! Mom is gonna KILL me!"

He saw a large puddle of water on the floor, and water all over his desk as well. He let out a deep sigh, just thinking about all the work he had to do cleaning it up by hand.

"Look at this mess!" he groaned. "All this water on my desk and on the floor... All this needs to be cleaned up!"

Then, in an instant, the water was GONE! The water on the floor had disappeared! And the surface of his desk was bone dry! Everything was cleaned up, like the accident had never happened!

"WHOA!" Josh gasped, as he saw how his entire room had changed within just a few minutes. His chair had changed, his bed had become a waterbed, and he had made the fishbowl grow into twice its size and back! "OH MY GOD!!!"

BOOOOMMM!!!!

The flash of lightning and loud rumble of thunder had startled the boy. Then, as he walked to the window, he realized that a storm was raging outside.

"Just as I was thinking about going outside, and it had to rain!" Josh grumbled.

So, what does Josh do next?
