As Josh stared at the rainfall outside, he thought about all of the crazy stuff that had happened to him since he had gotten home. His pets were strangely attracted to him and the furniture in his room was constantly changing. It was crazy!

Then Josh thought about the weird boy at church. Everything that had happened had occurred after that strange encounter. Did that mean he was really God?

The idea filled him with excitement as he began to think about what to do next. He was suddenly snapped out of his thoughts by the sound of pouring rain on his window. Josh realized that with the power of God, he could do anything, including stopping the rain!

Josh lifted his hand up towards the window. "Rain, I command you to stop!" he said, feeling a bit foolish while doing it.

However, the stormy clouds immediately turned back into their usual white color and the rain cleared up. The clouds parted and gave way to the sun, which shone down on the earth with radiant warmth.

Josh smiled, giddy with excitement at his first intentional use of his almighty power. Remembering his original intention, Josh put on some fresh clothes and bounded down the stairs.

"Wow, that storm really cleared up fast!" his mom remarked.

"Yeah, it sure did! I'm going to go outside," Josh said, slipping on his sneakers before dashing outside, being careful not to slip on the driveway made smooth by the fresh water.

Josh walked down the street, seeing people begin to come outside and talk to one another about the strange disappearance of the storm. Josh walked by them with a smile on his face, thinking about how wonderful life could be with god powers.

While Kate went off to find her mother, Josh walked back to where she was when she was stung by the bee. There, he spotted the side wall of the old wooden building where a hole in the wall alerted Josh to the possibility that the hive was hidden inside of the wall.

Just then, Kate came back with her mother!

"Josh! Thank you for helping Katie!" her mother said.

"Oh, you're welcome!" Josh replied. "But, I guess we need to get rid of the beehive before any other kids get stung by bees!"

Kate found a small piece of wood on the ground, which she picked up and brought it to Josh.

"Will this help?" she asked the young God.

"As a matter of fact, it will!" Josh grinned. "Just set that on the ground over here, near the wall!"

Kate set the small piece of wood on the ground, just as Josh requested.

"Okay!" Josh said out loud. "I want the piece of wood to turn into a two-by-two-foot mesh box with a cover on one side!"

Just as Josh commanded, the small piece of wood grew bigger and bigger, turning into the outer edges of a six-sided square box, measuring exactly two-feet wide, two-feet tall and two-feet deep. The top side of the box had hinges so it could open. Each side of the box was completely covered in mesh.

The cover opened up from the top of the empty box, which was just under the small hole in the wooden wall.

"There is a beehive inside of that wall!" Josh stated. "So.... I want ALL the bees to come out and fly into my box!"

"What? How can you..." Kate wondered out loud.

Suddenly, a swarm of bees came out of the hole and flew straight into the box! Once every single bee was inside of the box, the lid magically closed and sealed the box shut, trapping the bees inside!

"Now, I need a container for the honey!" Josh smiled.

A plastic container materialized in his hands, which was empty. The lid came off the container as the honey flowed from the hole on the beehive and flowed straight into the container, which Josh was holding in his hands. After about a minute or so, the box had completely filled up with raw honey when Josh closed the lid.

"There you go! Here's some honey for you!"

"Ohmygosh! How did you DO THAT????" Kate gasped.

Josh just turned towards Kate and smiled.

"Just trust in God, Katie! he commands things to do his will!"

"But... you just commanded the bees to go into the box!" the little girl observed. "Only God can do that!"

"Well... You have a good point, Katie!" Josh chuckled.

"YOU must be... God!" Kate replied.

"Yes... I hear your beautiful prayers every night, Katie!" Josh smiled as he squatted down. "Your daddy will get a new job next week! Your grandma has been sick last week but she'll get better. And your mom will be getting a raise at her job soon! I promise!"

"Oh! That is wonderful!" Kate's mother exclaimed.

"Thank you, God!" Kate replied.

"You can call me Josh for now, okay?" Josh said to her.

"Thanks, Josh!"

Then Kate and her mom walked off with the honey while Josh teleported the bees to a beekeeper's home.

He continued to walk down the street...

Josh and Steve were standing on the beach and looking out over the grey sky as the winds kicked in while the storm approached the city of Miami. Thousands of people had already evacuated and many more had already clogged the highway in order to leave the city.

1333321.content:
Josh and earl served during mass at the altar. They assisted the pastor and helped during the Communion. During the prayer, the altar boys were on their knees, just like the rest of the congregation, while the pastor was leading the prayers. Finally, the pastor paused in order to allow the people to give their own intentions, in silence of course. Josh was kneeling up front, at the altar, and he was hearing the prayers from all the members who were present in the sanctuary at that moment. In fact, a smile appeared on his face, especially since he heard the prayers of the kids as well. He even started glowing a little bit, although he was unaware of it at that moment, but several members of the congregation did notice it, including the young kids and the elderly. One of the children who noticed the faint blue glow around Josh's body during the moment of prayer was Erin, the girl who stopped the bullying before mass.

Once the mass was over, she walked up to Josh, who was standing in the lounge area since he had to carry the cross while leading the pastor out of the sanctuary following the end of mass. He was still wearing his robes, since the pastor had made the exception and allowed Josh to wear his white tunic as long as he wanted. So, it was easy to spot Josh among the crowd.

"Josh! Josh!" Erin said as she walked up to the altar boy.

"Hey! How's the karate-girl?" Josh grinned.

"Oh! That was nothing! I had to help you and Earl!" she smiled.

"Well, I really appreciate that! Earl was getting picked on again and I hate seeing the altar servers getting bullied before mass! That is so lame!" Josh explained.

"Hey! You guys are serving and helping out the pastor of the church and you guys are a very important part of the mass so there is no way I'm gonna let those bullies take advantage of my two favorite altar boys!" she affirmed. "Now, I need you to explain something to me!"

"Uhh... Sure?" Josh wondered.

"Why were you glowing during prayer?"

"Because... People were saying their prayers! Those prayers were very personal! It was really cool to hear them!" Josh responded.

"Yes, but... Those prayers were made to God!" Erin whispered to Josh.

Josh looked around. Luckily, most of the people had already left the sanctuary and he and Erin were now the last people left.

"Well... I can hear all those prayers!" Josh whispered to her.

"But... Only God can hear them, Josh!"

"Erin... I'm God!" he whispered back.

Erin just stared at the altar boy for a moment.

"Say what?"

Then Josh stared at her and made her believe him.

"Oh wow!" she exclaimed. "You... You're not kidding!"

"I am God!" Josh repeated. "I hear every prayer!"

Erin stared at him completely slack-jawed. This was unbelievable!

"I... I can't believe it! I'm talking to a kid who's... God?"

Josh just nodded.

"So... Okay! If you're God, then... Let's go to Disney World! Right now!" Erin grinned.

"Okay!" Josh replied.

Josh snapped his fingers and in a blink of an eye, Josh and Erin were standing before Cinderella's Castle in the Magic Kingdom at Walt Disney World in Orlando.

"No way... NO WAY!" Erin shouted as she looked around. It dawned on her where she was, as Josh looked on with a big smile on his face. "You have got to be KIDDING ME!"

"J-J-Josh... JOSH!" Erin stuttered, as she placed her hands on Josh's shoulders. "Did you... do this?"

Josh just nodded in reply.

"You... You're God? So... You can do anything?"

Josh nodded again.

"Okay! P-p-please... Send me... Send us back to church!" Erin said to him.

Josh raised his arm and snapped his fingers. In an instant, both of them were back at their parish.

"WHOA!" Erin gasped. "Ohmygod! Ohmy... Oh Josh! You're amazing! You... Can I take you out for lunch?"

"Oh, sure!" Josh shrugged.

"Wanna go to MacDonald's?" Erin asked him. "I mean... I hate the idea of taking God to lunch at MacDonald's but that's all I can afford!"

"It's alright! No problem!" Josh laughed. "Let's go!"

Then Josh snapped his fingers and the two of them appeared before the golden arches...

When Josh teleported back to his own house, he saw his mother standing outside, along with several neighbors. Then, he looked at the house and was startled for a moment: The house was on fire. Specifically, the kitchen and the wall seperating the kitchen and his bedroom had caught fire!

Josh then turned to the sky and wished for a might rainstorm. Big, thick, dark rain clouds came rolling in, while they all stood there, waiting for the fire engines to arrive. Flashes of lighning struck, followed by loud rumbles of thinder, just as Josh had commanded. Then, they all ran over to the neighbor's house as it started raining very hard.

Much of the rain helped put out the fire just in time before the fire engines arrived on the scene. They pulled out the fire hoses from the trucks and they went inside of the house. They put out the rest of the flames, which were caused by an electrical short in the old house. Josh and his mother spent the night at the neighbor's house, so Josh was able to return to his house the following day once school was over.

While walking through the damaged part of the house, Josh decided to use his powers to fix everything. After all, he didn't want his mother to suffer anymore than necessary. So he wished for the kitchen and for his bedroom to be restored to normal, like it was before the fire broke out, minus the electrical short which had caused the fire in the first place.

Once that was done, Josh was happy to walk around his room again, although he began to find his small bedroom rather tiny for a boy of his stature, who had quietly become God. He wondered if now was a good time to slightly upgrade his bedroom?

So, Josh willed for his bedroom to grow to three times bigger than it was before, with a thirty-foot ceiling and with two ceiling fans attached to the beams. Then, he wanted large, bright lights hanging from the ceiling as well. Lastly, he wanted hardwood flooring and a nice, round spa located in the corner of his bedroom, with a large king-size bed on one side and a large, oak desk on the other. The bed was a waterbed and he had a large dresser against the wall with a full-body mirror next to it. He had his own bathroom and a large walk-in closet filled with nice clothing.

"There! Now, that's a bedroom fit for a God!" Josh grinned, as he walked around the large room.

On the desk there was the latest laptop with the newest Windows software, an iPad, and a Mac computer. He also had a large, 24-inch monitor and two large speakers and a webcam. Next to the desk he had a small stereo system as well. In short, he had everything he ever wanted. Lastly, Josh had the newest cell phone with all the newest features and the most memory.

Finally, in the other corner, he had a large flatscreen TV set with an Xbox console, a Sony Playstation 3, and a Wii. He had a bookcase with over 300 games and another bookcase with over 1,000 books! He had everything!

Josh just smiled. He knew he had spoiled himself. But, this was truly the first time he had used his powers on himself. He figured it couldn't be bad.

He lay on his bed and closed his eyes, as he meditated while he listened to a flood of prayer requests that he was getting from people all over the world.

Suddenly, he heard a pleasant voice of a boy, who greeted him.

"Hi Joshua!"

It wasn't a dream! That voice came from his room!

Josh opened his eyes and looked up at his visitor. It was...

1333321222.content:
A boy, about the same age as Josh, was looking down at him. He had brown eyes, brown hair which was straight and long, which reached just past his neck. The boy was a little over 5 feet tall and he wore sandals and a light brown tunic with a white rope around his waist. Josh immediately recognized him from the day he had received his godly powers!

"God?"

The boy looked up and examined the large bedroom with the high ceilings and the hardwood flooring.

"Nice place you got here! Is this your new room?"

"Oh! Oh, yes!" Josh said, as he quickly sat up on the edge of his bed. "I... Our house caught fire... And... My room was burned down and... I used my powers to give myself a bigger room... A room that I always dreamed about! Is... Is that bad?"

God shook his head.

"You're fine, Josh. You didn't do anything wrong!"

Josh quickly stood up and stood, facing the boy in the brown robe.

"If you want me to put the room back the way it was, then I'll do it! I... I just wanted to give myself a bigger room! I'm sorry..."

"Josh! You have helped so may people already! It's not like you have abused your powers or your position! This is the only time you've used your powers on yourself. Maybe you need to do something fun!" God said, as he walked over to the spa.

Josh quickly followed God and walked next to him until the two boys were standing at the edge of the round spa.

"Let's test it!" God said.

Instantly, both boys were changed into wearing swimming trunks rather than the clothes they were wearing just a moment before.

God slowly walked down the steps of the spa, as the jets in the spa started making the warm water bubble. Josh followed right behind him and pretty soon, they were both in the water. God dove underwater and came up again, with his dark brown hair completely wet.

"Oooh! That felt great, Josh!"

"You need to come over more often, My Lord!" Josh grinned.

"Well, I have many other planets and galaxies to visit, and lots of people to see!" God replied. "But this is nice!"

"Wow! You go to other galaxies?" Josh wondered.

God swam over to Josh and placed his hands on Josh's shoulders. The boy looked Josh straight in the eyes.

"Joshua... There are billions of planets out there... Humans on earth have no idea how infinitely huge the galaxy is... Or how many millions of galaxies there are, which contain millions of planets inside of them! There are infinite number of stars and black holes out there! Humans cannot understand it!" God explained.

"Wow... I... I'm so honored... to have you here... That you trust me with your powers..." Josh replied calmly.

"Thank you for being a loyal servant and for being an altar server in church!" God replied. "I wish other parishioners were as passionate as you!"

Then God turned around and walked up the steps of the spa. Once he was out, he was instantly dried off and wearing his tunic again, with his sandals on his feet.

Josh quickly climbed out of the spa and did the same: Using his powers to dry himself and to change into his white robe and sandals as well.

"Please, My Lord... Please don't go!" Josh asked God. "Could you stay a little longer?"

"Sure!" God shrugged. "Show me some of the fun things you like to do!"

The two divine beings then walked around the large bedroom and looked through Josh's vast collection of books, they played music on his stereo, they surfed the web on his laptop, they played a game on his Xbox and they fed Sharkey, his goldfish.

Finally, God placed his hands on Josh's shoulders.

"Keep on helping other people. It's okay if you help yourself now and then, but spend the majority of your time using your powers to help others! I will come over now and then to answer any questions you may have, alright?"

"Thank you, My Lord! I'm truly honored to be your servant!" Josh replied.

"Good! Now be a good God to my people!" God said to Josh.

Then, God disappeared from Josh's room. The boy with the brown tunic was gone.

"Wow..." Josh sighed.

Again, it all seemed like an incredible dream, that Josh got to hang out with God and that he actually had God's powers. He felt great!

When Joshua arrived home, he found an unexpected person sitting on his bed in his bedroom! The boy was the same age as him, but he had jet-black hair and dark brown eyes. He was also wearing a robe like that of an altar boy, but his was brown. The boy was slightly taller than Josh, and he had a friendly expression on his face.

"Well, hello there, Joshua!" he said.

Joshua got back to his feet and looked God in his deep, brown eyes.

"I... I've been fine, God!" Joshua smiled. "I just need to find something for the kids in church to do..."

"Very good! May I suggest you find a way to bring them together so they can help someone less fortunate than them? They might want to help children who are poor, perhaps?" God suggested. "Every child must have the opportunity to serve and give to the poor!"

"Why... YES! Of course!" Josh said excitedly. "Thank you, God! That is brilliant! We'll get together and serve the poor! But... How do I know who is poor?"

Then God slowly disappeared from Josh's room.

"Well, I guess I'm still in charge... of the whole universe!" Josh grinned. "Time to serve the poor!"

Joshua just wanted to spend his day relaxing after the car wash. He really wasn't feeling tired at all. He realized that after he had gained his powers, he never really felt tired at all. It was one of the benefits of having his divine powers, he wondered. The downside was that he was always aware of his surroundings and of the people around him and their needs.

After a few minutes of sitting on the couch, he sensed something was off. He sensed that something was happening at the house next door. He quietly stood up and peered out the window. Then, he noticed that a man was trying to break in through the back door of the house. He had a van parked in the back of the house and he was trying to force the back door open using a metal bar. Josh decided to stop the robbery on his own. Normally he would be too scared to intervene, but he figured his powers would protect him from getting harmed.

The man wore a baseball cap and sweater as he broke the lock to the back door. He then snapped the door's lock and managed to get into the house. He walked in and wandered straight to the living room, where he looked around for any computers or TV sets. Once he spotted the large flatscreen TV, he started unplugging it from the wall and he disconnected all the wires in the back.

He lifted the TV screen off the stand and began to carry it out the door when he was stopped in his tracks by a young preteen boy with brown hair wearing only shorts and a tank top with tennis shoes.

"Where are you going with that?" Josh asked him. "That's not yours! This isn't your house!"

"Get outta here, kid..." the man growled. "Mind your own business!"

"I'll go... But you can't leave with the TV! That's not yours!" Josh pointed out.

The man became angry as he set the TV down and pulled a gun out of his pocket and pointed it at the boy.

"Okay kid... Let me say this one more time..." the robber roared. "Get out! NOW!"

The parishioners had gathered their food from the kitchen and they laid down several large blankets across the vast lawn in front of the church when three loud motorcycles returned after the sudden rain shower popped up out of nowhere.

Almost everyone had settled down for the large church picnic when the three large, loud motorcycles came running over the picnic blankets, rudely disrupting the peaceful outing.

Joshua saw this and became angry! Not these bikers again! What made it even worse was when one of the bikes rode over his blanket and destroyed his ham-and-cheese sandwich!

“That does it!” Josh growled angrily, as he stood up from his blanket, angrily facing the biker as he turned around a few yards away, turning to face him and come back on his bike, riding the bike bike fast, loud and with heavy metal music blaring from his boom box.

Joshua extended his arm and pointed his finger at the bike, causing the engine to shut down!

Instantly, the bike stalled and fell over on its side, causing the heavy-set rider to fall onto the grass.

Then, as the big, burly bike rider was about to get back on his feet, he witnessed Joshua point his finger at the bike a second time.

“Disassemble!” Joshua commanded out loud.

Instantly, every nut, every bolt, every screw, every clamp and every wire came apart, causing the entire motorcycle to fall apart as it lay on its side on the grass! It had become completely unusable!

“HOLY SHIT! MY BIKE!” the big biker man screamed, as he saw his motorcycle fall apart before his very own eyes.

The man stood up and gave Joshua an angry glance.

“That kid! He destroyed my bike!” he shouted as he pointed at Josh.

The two other bikers heard it and they rode their bikes towards him.

Joshua just remained calm as he glanced at the approaching motorcycles which instantly stalled as well. Then, just like the first one, the bikes fell over, causing their riders to fall down. Then, moments later, both remaining motorcycles came apart as well, as Joshua pointed his finger at them and commanded them to completely disassemble.

“MY BIKE!”

“HOW DID HE DO THAT?”

“WHO DID THAT?”

“THAT KID OVER THERE!”

“WHAT KID?”

“THAT KID IN THE WHITE ROBE!”

“HE BROKE OUR BIKES!”

Joshua was suddenly faced with three big, fat, and tall bearded men approaching him. They were NOT happy!

“Do you threaten God?” Joshua said calmly.

The men came closer as Joshua extended his arms and pointed his fingers at them.

When Erin and Josh were watching the news report on the large, flat screen TV, another newsflash appeared on the screen. A lady news reporter appeared on the screen holding a microphone in her hand as she was showing a large crowd standing behind her. The scene appeared to be just a few blocks away from where Erin and Josh were staying at.

“A lost rhino had just been reported as having escaped from the local zoo and the police is trying to contain the loose animal without having to shoot or kill it! We are asking all local residents of the area to stay indoors and to call 9-1-1 if they spot the animal roaming around their street!” the reporter said.

“What? That’s really close to us right here!” Erin said.

“Oh, I bet I can get the rhino to calm down!” Josh said as he stood up. Josh snapped his fingers and his church clothes changed into his soccer jersey, his tennis shoes and socks and his khaki shorts. “Come, let’s go get that poor rhino before it gets shot!”

Josh snapped his fingers again and Erin and Josh were instantly standing outside together, about two blocks away from their house. There was a whole commotion going on just down the street as there were people walking around, looking for the lost rhino.

“Do we have to go looking for the rhino?” Erin asked him.

“No. The rhino will come to me. Just watch!” Josh said calmly as he stood in the middle of the street located in the residential area.

“Really? The rhino is dangerous! It will just come up to you?” Erin asked him.

“Of course! Every animal on earth knows who I am! It comes to worship me! Look, there it is!” Josh grinned as the large rhino came from behind the woods and wandered over to where Josh was standing.

“Josh! I’m scared! It looks dangerous!” Erin said nervously.

“It won’t do anything! The rhino comes to worship me!” Josh said calmly as the rhino wandered up to Josh and lowered its head right before the boy’s feet. Josh reached out and petted the large animal gently.

“Good boy!” Josh said as the rhino just stood there, meekly awaiting Josh to give it any orders. “Just stay calm, buddy.”

Finally, zoo officials came along with two police officers. They came with a cage on a trailer behind a pickup truck.

“Go in the cage! Be good!” Josh ordered.

The rhino turned around and quietly wandered into the cage before the zookeeper closed the steel door on the trailer.

“Wow, I don’t know how you did it, kid, but thanks for calming down the stray rhino!” one of the officers said to Josh.

“You’re welcome, sir!” Josh grinned, as he waved at the rhino as it was taken away.

“Josh! You never cease to amaze me!” Erin grinned, as a dozen birds landed before Josh’s feet.

“People don’t know me, but the animals do!” Josh grinned, as lizards, birds, owls and squirrels and stopped and paused in front of Josh’s feet. “Alright, guys! Go on! Shooo!”

All the animals left as Josh commanded before Josh snapped his fingers, teleporting him and Erin back into the house…

“So, how did I do?” Supergirl said as she returned to where Josh was standing. She landed right next to him.

“Hey, you make a great Supergirl, Melissa! You were awesome!” Josh smiled. Any boy would be honored to be friends with you now!

"Huh?" asked Sean, "What do you mean?" His voice sounded funny, deeper than usual. "Why do I sound so funny?" Sean's voice sounded even deeper and more strange. Sean stood up and the floor seemed to be moving away from him. "Josh, what's going on?" His voice cracked when he said 'on'.

"There, all done," said Josh with a nod.

Sean looked at himself, hardly believing his own eyes. He walked to his full-body mirror and looked himself over. He was shocked at what he saw. Sean looked older, more grown up, than before by a lot. His hair was a darker brown than before. He had an Adam's Apple sticking out of his neck. He felt stronger than before and... taller.

Josh was glad he'd made Sean's clothing adjust to fit his now teenaged friend. Josh had always been tall for his age and thus Sean had been a few inches shorter than him for as long as the two had known eachother. Now, however, Sean was several inches taller. It looked like he'd grown a whole foot, from 4 foot 9 to 5 foot 9. "Josh..." began Sean. His adolesent voice surprised him so much he held his throat. "Josh, what's happened to me? I think I've grown up more than a little just now!"

"I did it, Sean," said Josh with a knowing smile, "I made you 13 years old."
144.title: Josh makes Sean a few years older

choices: Josh spends the night at Sean's house
Josh and Sean go to the mall
Josh and Sean go somewhere else
1441.content:
"Wow! Josh! I... I'm older and taller! I-I'm taller than you now!" Sean said, while looking down at Josh for the very first time. Sean was now 5 ft 9 inches tall, towering over Josh who was 9 inches shorter and 3 years younger.

"Yeah! Do you like it?" Josh asked him.

"I... It's awesome! But... Won't my friends and my parents freak out?"

"No... Everyone will think it's normal for you to be thirteen years old now!" Josh smiled.

"But... I was... when I was ten... I was in the fourth grade..."

"You're in middle school now!" Josh laughed.

"Wow..." Sean sighed.

"So... What are those new video games you wanted to show me?" Josh asked his best friend.

"Here... Oh... Wait a minute! How did you know I got new games?" Sean asked him.

"Like I said!" Josh shrugged. "I'm God!"

"You're not God! You're a little kid!"

"So? I teleported into your room, I made you three years older and I knew about your two new video games that you bought at the mall last night!" Josh explained. "One was for the Xbox and the other was for the Wii!"

"Holy smoke! You're not joking, are you? I mean... What else can you do?"

"Anything... I can do anything..." Josh said, as he walked towards the Xbox and pointed his finger at it. The TV set turned on and the game console switched on, completely on its own. The game controller levitated in mid air and flew into Josh's hands. "Let's play your new game!"

"Whoa!" Sean gasped, as he marveled at Josh's divine powers.

The two boys spent a few hours playing video games until they got tired of them. They had some snacks and sodas later on when they decided what to do next...
1441.title: Sean demands an explaination.

choices: "...I'll change you back to 10 years old."
"...I think I'll teach those bullies a lesson!"
14412.content:
"So, what do you want to do now?" asked Josh when they were thoroughly bored.

"Let's go to the GameStop in the mall," suggested Sean, "I have some old games to trade in and I do need to return this one..." He held up one of his new games which he only just now discovered had a large crack in the disk, making it unplayable.

"Alright," said Josh.

Sean walked around his room, searching for some old games of his. He found them on a high shelf. "Wow, I never could reach this before without a stool," said Sean with a grin, "That's really cool." He gathered his games together in his hand.

"Ready?" asked Josh.

"Yeah," nodded Sean. When Josh didn't do anything, he asked, "Aren't we going to teleport there?"

"Aren't you going to tell your mom where you're going first?" asked Josh with folded arms.

"Oh," said Sean, "right."

Josh and his now older friend walked out of Sean's room and went downstairs to find Sean's mom. "Mom," called out Sean, "I'm going to the mall with Josh!"

"Okay, sweetie, be back at a decent time!" replied Sean's mother from the dining room. Josh spotted that she was talking with Sean's dad over coffee.

"I think it's a little creepy," said Sean's dad. Josh didn't need his heightened senses and omnipotence to hear that. Sean heard it too. "Sean's 13 years old. He should be hanging out with kids his age." Sean stopped to eavesdrop and Josh joined him.

"Josh is his only friend, honey," said Sean's mother.

"Exactly," said Sean's father, "Josh is 10. Sean should be hanging out with other teens, checking out girls, you know, being a teenager. Not playing around like a little kid."

"Dear, isn't it a little early to be worrying about that? Just because he's 13 and looks a bit older than that doesn't mean he should be forced into growing up. Give him some time, maybe it's just a phase," said Sean's mother.

Sean looked at Josh curiously and Josh shrugged. Once they walked outside, Josh teleported the two friends to the entrance to the mall. "Why didn't you just take us inside?" asked Josh.

"I don't want to give everybody a heart attack when two people just appear out of nowhere," said Josh.

"Oh, that's right," said Sean. The two entered the large mall. There were people of all ages and all walks of life walking around, just like any typical mall. The kids and teenagers of the town liked hanging out here, also like any typical mall.

As they were walking, a group of guys Sean's new age spotted them. "Hey, look at the freak!" said one, refering to Sean.

"Hey, retard," said another. They said other things that were even ruder and they laughed. Josh could see behind the facade and saw how insecure they all were. He saw how scared and doubtful they were and it surprised him. Josh would've never guessed that was how a 13-year-old felt deep down inside. He never would've guessed that these teenagers made fun of someone else because they themselves were so insecure and unsure with themselves.

They walked off, laughing. "See ya, crybaby," said one as a parting remark. Josh looked at Sean. There were tears in his eyes and he started sobbing. Josh didn't need his powers to tell that Sean had been hurt. That much was obvious.

"Sean, are you alright?" asked Josh.

"I remember now what my life's like," said Sean, "you know, now that I'm 13... It's horrible, Josh. You're my only friend and everyone laughs at me at school. I'm beat up a lot and they all make fun of me..." He cried a bit. "I thought being 3 years older would be fun. I always thought I'd be so much more awesome when I'm older. I never thought it would be this bad..."

"I'm sorry, Sean," said Josh, "I didn't think of how your life would change when I made you older..."
14412.title: Josh and Sean go to the mall

"Josh, make yourself older, but a year older than me!"
144121.content:
"Okay, Sean! I don't want you to feel bad, all because of me!" Josh said. "So, either I change you back to 10 years old, or I'll deal with the bullies, or..."

Sean just stared at Josh for a moment.

"I'll just make myself three or four years older! How's that sound?" Josh explained with a grin on his face.

"You... You don't mind doing that?"

"Of course not!" Josh laughed. "I can always regress myself back to ten years-old!"

"Oh well... That would be cool, too! I... I don't want to be older than you, to be honest. I kinda would like for you.... I want you to be older and bigger than me... Just because you got the power and stuff..." Sean said in all honesty.

"Sean! It's alright! We can do it either way! You regress younger than me, or I age and become older than you!" Josh grinned. "I'll let you choose!"

Sean pondered what Josh said before he made his choice. Sean was 13 but Josh was now 10.

1441212.content:
Sean stood up and walk over to Josh. He was looking down on the younger boy.

"Well, I just it would be cool if you were bigger, taller, and a year older than me, for a change." Sean sighed. "Then my friends and my parents would quit picking on me for always hanging out with guys who are younger than me!"

Josh just smiled back. Then, he started aging rapidly, right before Sean's eyes! Josh grew bigger and taller, adding height and muscle to his frame. His hands and feet grew as well, so Josh had to make all his shoes, socks and clothes adjust to his size. Within seconds, Josh was standing six inches taller than Sean, at 6 feet tall, and 14 years old. He was bigger and more muscular than Sean as well!

"There. How do I look now?" Josh said in a slightly more baritone voice. "I'm fourteen now!"

"You... You look great!" Sean exclaimed. "You're bigger and taller than me, now!"

"Happy now?" Josh asked his best friend. But Sean had another request...

145.content:
Sean was Josh's geeky best friend who loved comic books and superheroes.

When Josh visits him and tells him that he is now God, Sean will ask him to make him to transform him into a superhero!

Which superhero does Sean want to be?

145.title: Sean wants to be a superhero

choices: Sean runs at super speed and ends up in California
Sean flies around the world and back
Sean takes Josh flying
1451.content:
Josh wanted to have some more fun with his cool new powers, but where would he go first?

Then he thought of Sean, that geeky kid from school who lived only three streets down from his own house.

Sean was very smart and he got straight A's in all his classes. He was really sharp and he always noticed everything. Sean was also an avid reader of books and comics. Needless to say, Sean had a massive comic book collection, which he inherited from his father and from his grandfather. He had gained boxes filled with literally thousands of comic books, which were each wrapped neatly in plastic bags and thin cardboard. Some of them were over forty years old!

Josh closed his eyes and concentrated on his friend when he snapped his fingers and focused on being at Sean's house. He disappeared from his bedroom and teleported to Sean's house, appearing instantly before the main entrance of his house. He rang the doorbell and waited. Josh decided not to teleport into Sean's bedroom just yet, because this was the first time he went to his friend's house since he gained his powers and he didn't want to scare him.

Sean opened the door and smiled right away. Sean was a few inches taller than Josh, and slightly more athletic. Sean had short, black hair and blue eyes.

"Hey, Josh! That's a surprise! Come on in!" he said, as he opened the door.

Sean and Josh walked into the house where Sean led his buddy into his bedroom.

"Hey! Want to play some video games?" Sean said.

Sean and Josh then took their game controllers and they spent about half an hour playing a game. Sean beat Josh easily since he was really good!

Josh looked around and spotted several comic book issue scattered all over Sean's bed.

"So, what are you doing? Are you reading some of your comic books?" Josh asked him, as he walked over to the bed and picked up one of the issues.

"Yeah! I found one of the issues of Superman from 1948... It's really old!" Sean grinned. "Superman is such an awesome hero! I wish he were real!"

Josh looked up at his buddy, who was standing next to the bed.

"Well, you would make a good Superman! You almost look like him!" Josh grinned.

"Uhh yeah but.... Having the costume is one thing... I wanna have his powers, too!" Sean sighed.

"Well, I can help you!" Josh smiled.

"What? What are you talking about?" Sean wondered.

"I'm God... I can make you into a superhero if I wanted to!" Josh explained.

"What? You're kidding!"

Josh continued reading the comic book as Sean stood there, feeling a weird tingling sensation which spread all over his body.

"Hey... What's going on?" Sean wondered.

Suddenly, Sean's muscles hardened! He felt his strength increase all over as every muscle started to inflate! His chest bulged out and his quads and calves gained more definition. His stomach gained washboard abs and his arms became muscular!

"What the---?"

Josh continued reading the comic book as Sean saw his shirt and jeans disappear. He was standing in his room wearing just his underwear when a thick, strong, stretchy blue-colored material like a body-suit began to cover his body. Red boots covered his feet up to his knees while a long, red cape draped over his broad shoulders. A red-and-yellow "S" symbol appeared on his broad chest as well.

Within minutes, Sean was looking exactly like a teenage version of Superman!

"JOSH! Look... Look at me!" he exclaimed.

Josh looked up and smiled.

"Yup! Just like in the comic book!" he laughed. "I got it right!"

"What? But... I... How...?" Sean stuttered.

"Let's go outside so you can fly around and try out your new powers?" Josh suggested.

Sean was completely astounded. Powers????

info.brief_description: A ten year-old boy becomes God on Earth. How does he use his unlimited, divine powers?
info.description:
This is the story about Josh, who has an encounter with God after the Creator decides to take a vacation and pass on his powers to an average human being for the length of a cosmic day, which has an undefined length of time.

God appears to a young boy, who serves as an altar boy in his church. For reasons unknown, God has chosen this boy named Joshua, and passes on his powers to him and makes the boy the new God.

You can see a picture of what Josh looks like, here:
http://www.writing.com/main/images/item_id/1915613-Joshua-Almighty

Have fun with the new story where the boy gains the power to do ANYTHING, ANYWHERE TO ANYONE AT ANY TIME. Basically, Joshua is given UNLIMITED POWER and he has absolute control over the entire universe. Now, Josh is not evil, rather, he is willing to help anyone anywhere. But, who will believe that a young boy is God??

Joshua sees and hears everything and everyone, everywhere through all times and ages in the Cosmos. He also hears all the prayers of every human being on earth from the past, present and future. Help Josh as he takes on the role of God in the body of a young boy!

Please, no vore, no sex scenes, and no foul language. Gift points for good additions of 300 words or more. This story is meant to be inspirational, so please keep it that way.
